result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cody Alan Brantner

records.addlTxt: The Court hereby approves the Diversion Agreement on the above case.

2:40 PM Prosecuting attorney John Harrison Sacia in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Cody Alan Brantner in court.  Attorney Jeffrey C. Mochalski in court for Cody Alan Brantner. Joint recommendation presented to the court along with Trempealeau County Case Numbers 21CT45 and 21CF201.  Court advised defendant of rights/max penalties.  Defendant KVI waives all rights and enters NC Plea to count 2.  Court finds defendant G of count 2 and places defendant on 36 month Diversion agreement.  Counts 1 and 3 DRI.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:57 PM Prosecuting attorney Micabil Diaz-Martinez in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Cody Alan Brantner not in court.  Attorney Jeffrey C. Mochalski in court for Cody Alan Brantner. Defense advised did not get finalized offer from state. Defense requests to reschedule. Court questions state. State makes argument, trying for global resolution. PLEAS set. Bond cont.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

9:31 AM Prosecuting attorney Micabil Diaz-Martinez in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Cody Alan Brantner appeared by phone.  Attorney Jeffrey C. Mochalski appeared by video for Cody Alan Brantner. Court advised conflict due to recovery court. Defense advised has not spoken with defendant, leaves to defendant to decide. Court advised can bring up at next hearing, will stay on for the mean time until able to talk with counsel. State has no objection. Defense requests to set for PLEAS. State agrees. PLEAS set. Bond cont.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Attorney Mochalski advised defendant waives reading of information and enters NG pleas. Defense advised does not need PTC. STC set. Bond cont.

1:22 PM Prosecuting attorney Micabil Diaz-Martinez in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Cody Alan Brantner appeared by phone.  Attorney Jeffrey C. Mochalski appeared by video for Cody Alan Brantner. Def wishes to waive right to PH. Court advised def right to PH. Def KVI waives right to PH. Court finds def KVI waives right to PH. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds over for further proceedings. Information filed. Atty Mochalski states def waives reading of information and enters NG plea. STC set. Bond to continue.
Status Conference scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status Conference on May 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant not to possess or consume a controlled substance without a valid prescription. Defendant not to possess drug paraphernalia. Defendant to have no contact with co-defendant Bruce Kirkeng.

1:38 PM Prosecuting attorney John Harrison Sacia in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Cody Alan Brantner appeared by video, in custody from the TC Jail.  Attorney Jeffrey C. Mochalski appeared by video for Cody Alan Brantner. Court advised defendant of rights/max penalties. Defendant waives reading of complaint, has possible global resolution. WPH set. Bond cont.
Waiver of Prelim scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Waiver of Prelim on April 19, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Initial appearance on April 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant not to possess or consume a controlled substance without a valid prescription. Defendant not to possess drug paraphernalia. Defendant to have no contact with co-defendant Bruce Kirkeng.
11:37 AM DA John Sacia appeared by video for the State. Defendant appeared by video in custody from TC jail without counsel. State makes bond argument. Defendant does not object. SIBS. INIT set.
